questions.questionText:
Four calls came in reporting the sounds of gunfire coming from a house. The addresses the callers gave for where the gunshots came from were:

Caller #1: 6597 Telegraph Street.

Caller #2: 5597 Telegraph Street.

Caller #3: 5997 Telegraph Street.

Caller #4: 5507 Telegraph Street.

Which of the following addresses is most likely correct?

options.text: 5597 Telegraph Street
6597 Telegraph Street
5997 Telegraph Street
5507 Telegraph Street

questions.questionText:
There was a traffic accident at a very busy intersection. Several witnesses describe the course of events as follows:

Witness #1: A vehicle was pulling left out of the parking lot and was struck by a drunk driver who didn't stop for the red light.

Witness #2: A vehicle pulled out of the parking lot too quickly and was struck from the side by a drunk driver.

Witness #3: A vehicle was just beginning to turn left when out of nowhere came the man in the blue Chevy.

Witness #4: A drunken man was traveling very fast and ran the red light.

Which of the following scenarios is most likely correct?

options.text: A drunken man was traveling very fast and ran the red light.
A vehicle pulled out of the parking lot too quickly and was struck from the side by a drunk driver.
A vehicle was pulling left out of the parking lot and was struck by a drunk driver who didnâ€™t stop for the red light.
A vehicle was just beginning to turn left when out of nowhere came the man in the blue Chevy.

questions.questionText:
A group of women were seen tossing lit cigarettes into a trash container which caught fire. Several people saw the group of women and gave the following descriptions:

Witness #1: A group of black women that were wearing tank tops.

Witness #2: A group of white women that were wearing tank tops.

Witness #3: A group of white women that were cursing.

Witness #4: A group of Hispanic women that were wearing skimpy outfits. Which of the following descriptions is most likely correct?

options.text: A group of black women that were wearing tank tops.
A group of black women that were cursing a great deal.
A group of white women that were wearing tank tops.
A group of Hispanic women that were wearing skimpy outfits.

questions.questionText:
A car was seen weaving wildly down a road and it appeared the driver was intoxicated. Several witnesses provided police with the following license plate numbers and letters for the vehicle:

Witness #1: Q38TP.

Witness #2: O37TF.

Witness #3: O387F.

Witness #4: O38TF.

Which one of these license plate numbers and letters is most likely correct?

options.text: Q38TP
O37TF
O387F
O38TF

questions.questionText:
George, a man with failing memory, is missing from the nursing home. Four people described what they recalled George was wearing earlier in the day:

Person #1: A dark bathrobe, a white T-shirt, gray pajama pants, and blue slippers.

Person #2: A dark sweatshirt, gray pants, and blue shoes.

Person #3: White pajamas and grey slippers.

Person #4: A navy blue bathrobe over a white pajama set.

Which of the following descriptions is most likely correct?

options.text: White pajamas, a white T-shirt, blue pants, and gray slippers.
A navy blue bathrobe, a white shirt, and white sneakers.
A navy blue bathrobe, white pajamas, and blue slippers.
A dark sweatshirt, gray shirt, blue pants, and white slippers.
